title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesnâ€™t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Post With Code
text: This is a post with executable code.

title: Projects
text:
A web-based simulation tool that allows users to design and evaluate customized milk feeding plans for dairy calves. Developed in R + Shiny and based on NASEM (2021) nutrient requirements, CalfSim enables dynamic modeling of growth, cost per kg of gain, and feeding strategies under different scenarios.
ðŸ”— Try CalfSim




A modeling tool developed to evaluate dairy farm management strategies with focus on greenhouse gas emissions, nutrient excretion, and overall sustainability. Contributed to the integration of biological processes across the system and development of custom outputs for decision support.
ðŸ”— More resources and tools




Led a multidisciplinary project combining drone imaging, machine vision, and AI to estimate cattle weight and monitor feed bunk management in large commercial feedlots in Brazil. Integrated fieldwork with algorithm development and cross-functional collaboration between agri-tech and data science teams.




Worked with the DairyBrain team at UWâ€“Madison on building real-time decision support tools. Focused on: - Data engineering for sensor and management data streams - Predictive models for milk production, feed intake, and economic outcomes - Visualization and dashboards for use at the farm level

ðŸ”— More resources and tools




Led a multidisciplinary project combining drone imaging, machine vision, and AI to estimate cattle weight and monitor feed bunk management in large commercial feedlots in Brazil. Integrated fieldwork with algorithm development and cross-functional collaboration between agri-tech and data science teams.




Worked with the DairyBrain team at UWâ€“Madison on building real-time decision support tools. Focused on: - Data engineering for sensor and management data streams - Predictive models for milk production, feed intake, and economic outcomes - Visualization and dashboards for use at the farm level

title: Projects
text:
ðŸš§ Ongoing Projects

CalfTools (R Package)
Development of a modular R package for calf nutrition modeling, including prediction of growth, energy/protein requirements, cost optimization, and integration with on-farm data. The goal is to offer a reproducible, open-source alternative for academic and practical use.



Cotricalc System: Dairy Cost Estimation Tool
A modular decision-support platform under development in partnership with Cotrijal cooperative. Built using Shiny + Google Sheets, the tool aims to help producers monitor costs, margins, and resource allocation for dairy production in southern Brazil.



Behavioral Monitoring & Anomaly Detection
Building predictive models using sensor data (e.g., rumination, feeding, activity) to identify behavioral anomalies and management deviations. Intended for integration into daily routines by producers and technicians to improve welfare and productivity.


This page is constantly updated with recent and ongoing work. If youâ€™d like to collaborate, feel free to reach out.
